page.description: Web publishing applications only. You can control access to your web application pages by:

case.description: Requiring login with or without additional passwords
Specifying which pages require user login
Granting page access only to specified groups

section.description: The A5W pages processed by the Application Server :

case.description: Can open local URLs only under the local webroot
With Xbasic can open, read, and write files both inside and outside of the webroot folder structure

section.description: When used with Alpha Five databases, A5W pages:

case.description: Cannot run any code or modify any variables located inside your database.
Cannot access the desktop user interface
Cannot access to the desktop's global variables

section.description: In addition, you can prevent pages from being cached in the user's web browser.

case.description: Local, shared, and global variables created by Xbasic code inside a page exist only for as long the A5W page exists.
Protected session variables cannot be seen by end users.
The HTTPS protocol, which uses the SSL transport for encrypted communications
A Server Certificate which confirms your website's identity for your users
